description: Becomes prime after exactly 3 iterations of f(x) = sum of prime factors of x.
comments: f(x) = sum of prime factors without multiplicity, so that f(1500) = 2+3+5 = 10.
mathematica: aQ[n_] := Length[NestWhileList[Plus @@ First /@ FactorInteger[#] &, n, ! PrimeQ[#] &]] == 4; Select[Range[2, 330], aQ] (* _Jayanta Basu_, Aug 10 2013 *)
author: _David W. Wilson_
